intro: Hieraciodes olympica, commonly known as Olympic mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Olympic Mountains in Washington State. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy alpine species. Its foliage consists of narrow, silver-green leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and wind. Hieraciodes olympica is a rare and endangered plant, highlighting the importance of preserving its natural habitat.
